content.label: The game is overall very good but since you need to pay for it it would be great if you could actually see your car on track because you create a unique car for your team and it is useless. Obviously it is not impossible to do since F1 has made a mobile game showing the cars

title.label: Great game but missing two things

content.label: Very fun. I played the first a lot, but skipped the second. Opened the wallet for this one and gameplay is great, but really wish it used the full screen on my iPad Pro 11. Also wish it had for 3-D models of the cars. Not in the race, necessarily, but just when choosing your livery it would be nice to see the whole car.

Normally, when picking a racing game, I like being in the cockpit, racing the other drivers and fighting for first. This is normally NOT my kind of game. That being said, as someone who went in expecting to not be impressed with the game, I have had a great experience. The strategy of the game is unparalleled by any other strategy game I have ever played, you have to be careful to work within your budget, and the races are BY NO MEANS HANDS OFF GAMEPLAY! You need to watch and observe your drivers carefully, listen to their suggestions, keep an eye on the weather, and change tires and engine power. I can not endorse this game enough, it is a must play!
Please make it to where if you have the game editor you can add or replace tracks without using influence points

Is all that‚Äôs missing. I‚Äôve been playing this game since long before Sega. I like what they‚Äôve done with the mobile version and would love to see it translated to Apple TV as well. I also own the Mac version but find it takes more of a commitment to play, so I‚Äôm usually on my iPad. It would be great to pick up my game on my large screen TV.

title.label: Great game, nothing negative, but can you add one more thing?

content.label: I love this game. I play it a lot and it is really addicting. For future games, or in some update to this game, is it possible to eventually add the Circuit de la Sarthe? It would be very interesting to have a 24 Hours of Le Mans race in this game that you could do. I would do this immediately. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love the game and the way it is, but if it‚Äôs possible, could you implement the 24 Hours of Le Mans?
Great graphics easy to play great depth

title.label: Fantastic but really do I have to watch circles?

content.label: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, this is one of the most addictive motorsports games I‚Äôve played. It‚Äôs fantastic and I love it. If the next version could PLEASE have little cars instead of circles racing around the track it would literally be perfect. Thats the only thing missing to add a little extra flair and excitement to the races. I want to see my cars vying for position and the overtakes etc. not a circle.....maybe MM4! Make it happen thanks!

Absolutely fantastic game that will satisfy the urge to pull your phone out at the DMV. However, there is a drastic over representation of females in the game. I want the realism to retain to the real sport. Where the representation is accurate. Imagine if they made a game about putting makeup on as a business and 50% of the customers are dudes

Where to start... first off what a great game it‚Äôs an huge improvement over the MM2. The graphics are great but not a huge upgrade from MM2. One thing that needs refining is the hair of the avatars they need to be integrated better I find some hair pieces don‚Äôt look natural at all. But not a big deal (plus hair always looks strange on avatars) 

This game is just so addictive it‚Äôs insane I will just play in forever all day every day it‚Äôs great. 

But Are there plans to integrate more stuff into the game or will that be in MM4?

I would love to see and Indy Car or Formula E In a future version of the game. And a multiplayer mode would be great too!!!

The NEW Endurance mode is well made but not my favorite it‚Äôs a lot more micro management, but I‚Äôve only done 1 invitational in it so idk yet. The NEW elimination mode it awesome so much fun and a good change to the normal race style. The NEW mechanics are great everything about then so well implemented. 
I don‚Äôt really understand the NEW suppliers aspect besides the face that it gives you more bonuses.  The NEW influence system and NEW voting system is soooooooooo good it‚Äôs very good.  

In the end it‚Äôs a great game definitely worth the price and I would give it 5 stars but I don‚Äôt believe in a perfect game. But they came close.
Cheap and good. Worth the money!
Was fun to play for awhile. Got repetitive. When‚Äôs the next one?

‚Äú...could be hard for slower teams like Astra‚Äù. It‚Äôs the 9th out of 10 races in the season, and I‚Äôve qualified first for and won every one of the races. There‚Äôs seems to be an issue with commentary, as taking pole and winning 9 out of the 9 races I‚Äôve ran certainly doesn‚Äôt make me a ‚Äúslower team‚Äù

Second complaint: Condense the text screens some how. It‚Äôs gotten to a point to where I tap ‚Äúcontinue‚Äù repeatedly because there‚Äôs so many slides. Put them all into one screen, maybe something like a mailbox to check. 

Other than those two, the game is near perfect!

This is hands down one of the best sport manager games available and is well worth the money. My only issue is how perfect the bots are, and at times they almost seem cheaty. I‚Äôve seen countless times a computer go around the last 3 laps or so on  less than 10% Hyper Soft tires and that‚Äôs just not ok because I can‚Äôt make it one lap, event on conservative driving and 100% tire wear. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever witnessed a car (other than my own) have to limp around a track because of a tire blowout, fuel shortage, or any other factor than a crash. And I experimented and it‚Äôs like this on all 3 difficulties. A multiplayer system could be a way to take my mind off that ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

It starts out a little slow as you are a new team but as you learn to strategize and earn more money it is a great game!  The only thing I‚Äôm hoping for in the next one is more oval tracks, or and endurance season instead of just the single race.
This is one of the greatest games that I‚Äôve ever played, but it would be even better if there was online multiplayer, this seems like a game that would be a lot of fun to play with friends
Funny how there‚Äôs a flag of Hong Kong but not the flag of Taiwan.
I think there‚Äôs a bug I found in the game. When the safety car is out some cars would tend to overtake you which I believe is not permitted.
Love this game no complaints at all but it be nice if they added more features but overall worth all the four bucksüëçüèºüëçüèº
I‚Äôve been playing it for a long time... and it needs updates!
I have all three but couldn‚Äôt get into the first two. This one I‚Äôm totally addicted to!

I normally don‚Äôt write reviews, but I had to give feedback on this game because I wanted it to be great so badly. And in the grand scheme of things, this game is really fun. The racing seems to be improved, and there‚Äôs definitely a learning/development curve whenever you change racing leagues. BUT there‚Äôs one feature that absolutely kills this game for me, the card-based qualifying. As someone who actually works in data acquisition for a racing team, this feels like a slap in the face after the rest of the Motorsport manager series. I really enjoyed getting feedback and making changes in the PC version, but nope we got AR. So while that‚Äôs never going to change can we at least get 2018 iPad Pro support?

Let‚Äôs be honest, the iPads can handle a straight pc port so why continue to release a dumbed down version each time?

I was hoping with this version you finally figured out that your fans do not like in any way shape or form the stupid colored dots instead of cars.  Why would you continue to punish us with a dot racing experience in a car racing game?
Its a great game and i would totally recommend it to anybody. But please help I accidentally purchased the editor bundle and it is nit restoring my purchase!!!!!!!!

title.label: Great but want to see more

content.label:
Had a blast playing many seasons. I want an update with new tracks or something. 

What I would really like to see is a MOTO GP version of this. I think there would be some awesome potential there and I would definitely buy that app too. Keep it up guys

One of the things that I enjoyed in the previous Motorsport manager game was that you could change the gear ratios and change the amount of downforce on the car. Now, it‚Äôs a luck based system. I know that a lot of people would like to see the player controlled setup come back. This would make the game that much better. Other than that and some minor flaws, this is one of the better games out there.
Keep up the good work

Having played the second one, I can honestly say that most of this game is copy and pasted. This wouldn‚Äôt be a problem, except most of the useful features are the same. They also added 2 new ways to race, and so I expected accurate mechanics, 3,2 or 1 car depending on the race series, etc but all this really gave is new maps, nothing else.

I recently saw this game on the App Store and took a chance and got it it looked like a good game.So I go into it and it‚Äôs a very fun and entertaining game that has differences from other racing games.i recently got an iTunes gift card and I decided to spend some money since everything in the shop was cheap.So I buy it and wait it starts loading and loading and eventually I waited for about 40 mins when I decided to restart the app.when I restart the app usually games will process the currency that you bought and you will see it when I get on.so I get on and I check my save and there Is still no money there .i press on it agin and and it says you have bought this and it will be restored with no charge.so it takes me to the same loading screen and I wait for an hour until I realize I wasted 10 dollars and might as well delete the game.think twice before buying in app purchases or even buying this game at all.

I feel like there are some improvements that can be made, such as more tracks, drivers picking their numbers, longer races, better qualifying system, third drivers, practice, longer contracts and more realistic pay from sponsors, more expensive upgrades to car, speedometer, and throttle/brake monitor.  But I think something really cool would be a driver stats database so you can compare your drivers stats to retired drivers stats, and just for record keeping.  Things like wins, podiums, and DNFs would be kept in there and I think that would be so cool to compare, similar to football manager.  But overall great game!

title.label: Best IPad Game I Have Played in a Long Time

content.label: I don‚Äôt usually write reviews here but after staying up too late to play this last night, I will make an exception here. It is very intuitive and easy to understand as well as a much deeper simulation than most games you find here. Definitely worth the money to download and play.
It‚Äôs a very good game but I want longer races
Save 2$ and buy MM2 MM3 is basically just copying MM2 except the new race modes. I also just don‚Äôt get the point of those cards and how they make your car go faster?

Never having played the first or second one (or any [insert sport here] manager game)I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect. This game is beyond addicting, and if you‚Äôre smart enough, you won‚Äôt need to bother with the microtransaction. That being said: one of the biggest aspects that could be improved upon in an update or even MM4 would be the sponsorship system. Frankly there needs to be longer sponsorship contracts (like a complete season), or contracts that you can renew/negotiate, or make them worth more than they currently are. While I‚Äôm not the most learned in the minutiae of F1 or WEC, I don‚Äôt think teams‚Äô contracts expire after X-races, and once those contracts expire, the company doesn‚Äôt wash their hands of the race team. So why can‚Äôt I renew with a company that I really like? Because of this, I haven‚Äôt figured ‚Äúthe sauce‚Äù with enduro-racing. Maybe it‚Äôs me, and having to sign six drivers with those tiny sponsorship deals, but I‚Äôll keep playing to figure it out. One final addendum, would be driver testing. No race team would just sign a driver without seeing how they drive in their (the race team‚Äôs) car. Why expect the manager to plop down a stack of cash on a shot in the dark? TL;DR This game is well worth the price, don‚Äôt buy the microtransactions, and be smart with your in-game money.

title.label: People I would like to see in the game

content.label:
I love the game every aspect of it it‚Äôs amazing the one thing that I would change about it is the ability to have more than 3 mechanics. but I would really like to see more people in there like dragon speed‚Äôs racers like Nicolas lapierre

First time I‚Äôve played in a little while and the loading screens are a bit quicker now and the game doesn‚Äôt crash as much. Kudos for taking criticism and working to fix. Fun game.

content.label: I‚Äôm hoping that everyone has a different car and a different look and more advanced customization feature like checking engine and I want them to add Car Visual so that it would be cooler to see car moving in the racing platform and also in AR.

This game is amazing! The only things I want are for there to be a tier 1 for every Motorsport, also a mode for MotoGP or bikes in general. I‚Äôd also like a drop in price for the customization but that‚Äôs just me being stingy, not an actual request
Great game but kept crashing after seasons

I like this game a lot but there are a few things like practice sessions those are very important in Motorsport. Also I would like to see tire allocations that would add another level of strategy to the game. And last I think engine components would also add to the strategy but make them be able to be shut off for the people who do not like them. Engine components would also make the game more in depth with real life making three of every component would make you plan more about the races. Last but not least make the track grip go up so the times will get more competitive at the end of the session making for more close racing. That is all this game needs to be a great game
I think you guys should add real teams and people but make the game cost more so you can still make more money. Lots of people will buy it but also make it more in depth for the career mode.

You should be able to race to stay on the lead lap. Especially on ovals. Multiple times getting slowed my the person in first causes me to get passed my someone else or I‚Äôm faster than them and every time I get passed them I get a blue flag and have to let them pass back by. After your a lap down about to get lapped a second time is when the blue flags should come out. Great game still play every day.

title.label: New iPhone X can‚Äôt see left side

content.label: Is there a setting that shrink screen just enough to avoid eyebrow on iPhone X?   Cans see the driving pylon.  Otherwise best mobile game ever.

title.label: Good, but needs iPhone X support

content.label: The game itself is enjoyable, definitely worth the money. My only complaint is that it needs iPhone X support. The notch covering the leaderboard is distracting at best, and disrupts the game especially when trying to tap on the leaderboard. Maybe adjust the leaderboard to better fit.

I really enjoy this game; and this is coming from a gamer that never games on mobile. The management aspect is fantastic and the races are beautiful. The AR aspect is a really nice touch as well that I enjoy a lot more than I thought I would. Keep up the great work devs and team!
Game is just not fun ... click buttons and watch dots do loops .. sigh ~ what a waste
Pretty good. I enjoy building up my drivers to compete with others. But the blue flags are so annoying. It‚Äôs like ur driver slams on the brakes and cost you about 5 seconds on that lap

First off want to say great game can‚Äôt stop playing. But would like to throw some ideas for an update or MM Mobile 4, would like to see a lil more managing on individual racers like I started my story with my dad as my manager and me as the racer then I retired my dad and I as a racer took over as manager I guess what I think would be interesting is if you can give your consumers the ability to retire managers and racers and the game can identify family members by last name and more commentary I think it‚Äôs cool hearing about my team and other teams being mentioned throughout the circuit season
